result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Brett M Bents was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Will be eligible for 50% reduction in cost/maintenance of IID

miscConds.notes: Will be allowed Huber for work and to attend AODA counseling

Plus Supervision Fees.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due and all available enforcement actions may be used to collect the debt.  You must  keep the Clerk of Circuit Court informed of your current address until the debt is paid in full.

timeConds.notes: 31 days credit will apply to conditional jail time, will have good time.

records.addlTxt: Associated with Charge #1

Defendant Brett M Bents in court with attorney Annette M. Barna.  Rachel Payne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DE will waive PSI preparation.  Case settlement has been reached in this matter. 

 Court will order sentence withheld, 3 yrs probation, will serve one year jail, fine of $1977.00, 33 month revocation of DL, IID for 33 months, 50% reduction in cost/installation of IID, will have huber for work and to attend AODA counseling,  has credit for 31 days, credit will apply to conditional jail time, will have credit for good time, no possession or consumption of alcohol, no drug possession or consumption, do not enter premises where alcohol is the primary business.  

14CM43-withhold sentence, 1 yr probation, CC.
Sentencing hearing at 06-16-2015 10:00 am
filed in 14CF41
Case settlement, filed in 14CF41

Defendant Brett M Bents in court with attorney Annette M. Barna.  Rachel Payne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 14CM43.  Court instructs on plea questionnaire/waiver of rights.  DE has not completed the IDIP program.  DE will enter a plea of NC to Ct 1 in 14CF41 and NC to Ct 1 in 14CM43, court will accept and find the DE guilty.  CT's 2,3 will be dismissed in 14CF41, modifiers in 14CM43 will be dismissed.  The court will order a PSI be prepared.  Will schedule for sentencing after receiving PSI.
Court recalling case-DE must report to jail today, Atty asking for Huber.  Court will allow Huber while PSI is being prepared.   Court will set for sentencing 6-16-15 @ 10:00AM.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 6, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Attorney Annette M. Barna in court.  Rachel Payne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 14CM43.  DE does not appear.  Per his attorney DE is enrolled in the IDIP.  Set for plea/sentencing 4-06-15 @ 1:00PM.
OF NOH-NOT DELIVERABLE AS ADDRESSED
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 30, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
Status hearing on December 15, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Annette M. Barna in court.  Rachel Payne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DE appears telephonic.  Heard along with 14CM43.  DE will reenter the ISP progam if allowed by the court.  Set for 3-30-15 @ 1:00PM for plea hearing, status hearing 12-15-14 @ 10:00AM.  If verification is supplied to Atty of reenrollment DE will not need to attend this hearing.
Plea hearing on November 10, 2014 at 03:30 pm.
Plea hearing on October 27, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Brett M Bents in court telephonic with attorney Annette M. Barna.  Rachel Payne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 14CM43.  Waive reading of the information in 14CF41, enter NG plea's.  Court will accept the NG plea's.  Set out for the end of October, set for a plea.  Amend the CC on record for 14CF41, as to the correct administer of the intoximeter.  State will file an amendment as to this.  JA will set.
DEFENDANT IS NOT TO CONSUME OR POSSESS ALCOHOL.  DO NOT ENTER PREMISES WHERE ALCOHOL IS PRIMARY BUSINESS, ANY BARS, TAVERNS OR LIQUOR STORES WITH THE EXCEPTION OF HIS EMPLOYMENT AT WALMART.
Arraignment on August 5, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Brett M Bents in court with attorney Annette M. Barna.  Rachel Payne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Def will waive the prelim hearing this day.  Court goes over waiver of prelim with DE. Court will accept waiver.   Court finds probable cause exists and will bind over for JT.  Atty would like to address the issue of bond.  Information filed this day in court.  Atty does not wish to proceed to arraignment at this time.  Atty wishes to wait till after discovery is received for arraignment.  Set for arraignment 8-05-14 @ 10:00AM.  Set 14CM43 with this case.  DE is enrolled in the IDIP program, Atty wishes to have her client released from twice daily PBT's.  State opposes, wishes to keep once daily PBT's.  The court will drop the PBT requirement at this time.  DE will sign a new bond reflecting this change.
Info on PBT locations signed by DE.

DEFENDANT IS NOT TO CONSUME OR POSSESS ALCOHOL.  DO NOT ENTER PREMISES WHERE ALCOHOL IS PRIMARY BUSINESS, ANY BARS, TAVERNS OR LIQUOR STORES WITH THE EXCEPTION OF HIS EMPLOYMENT AT WALMART. WILL DO TWICE DAILY PBT'S,  MAY DO PBT'S AT OTHER LOCATIONS IF APPROVED THRU RUSK AND ACCEPTING COUNTY, BUT THIS WILL BE AT NO EXPENSE TO RUSK COUNTY.
Preliminary hearing on July 15, 2014 at 08:00 am.

Defendant Brett M Bents in court with attorney Annette M Barna appearing telephonic.  Andrea A Nodolf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Waive formal reading of Criminal Complaint.  DE has not been able to post the cash bond, was to start a new job, Att asking for sign bond with twice daily PBT's.  State asks for a $5000.00 sign bond, no alcohol possession or consumption, with the exception of employment at WalMart DE is not to be anywhere alcohol is present no bars, taverns or liquor stores, will do twice daily PBT's at the direction of the SD Dept.  DE/Att will waive time limits for prelim hearing.  Court informs of waiver of time limits, will accept waiver.  DE would like mail sent temporarily to the address entered today in court.   Set for 7-15-14 @ 8:00AM, Prelim hearing.   14CM43 will track.
